alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Johnson; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, northern Johnson, southeastern Hendricks and Marion Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mooresville, or 12 miles southwest of Indianapolis, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenwood, Southport, Beech Grove and Lawrence. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 98 and 119. Interstate 69 near mile marker 200. Interstate 70 between mile markers 64 and 92. Interstate 74 between mile markers 93 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Indiana.
